---
title: "Volunteer with THRIVE"
---

Help your communities to THRIVE! We invite you to join THRIVE Lifeline's international 
team of volunteers and begin offering life-saving and life-affirming support. 
Our volunteers are students and professionals, working remotely from all over the world. 
When you volunteer with us, you will be provided opportunities for mentorship, skill 
development, and leadership growth. Whatever your passions or experience level, we have 
a place for you!

<br>
Volunteer with THRIVE! [**Apply Here**](https://form.jotform.com/201655418668059).
We will reply within 48 hours.

Requirements:

* 18+ years old
* Identify as an underrepresented individual
* Crisis Responders: Willingness to complete a minimum of 40 hours of training, 
generally in 4 weeks (accelerated) or 8 weeks (traditional). Crisis Responders commit 
to one or two 3-hour on-call shifts per week for 1 year,
    + Training is a hybrid of synchronous and asynchronous readings, exercises, 
      practices and shadowing
    + Training must be completed in no more than 6 months
    + If you are interested in an accelerated training schedule, please inquire.
* Non-Crisis Response: Willingness to complete 4 hours of training and the estimated weekly time 
commitment given below
* Willingness to listen non-judgmentally to those in crisis

Note: No prior experience is necessary. We promise mentoring all along the way,
as well as high quality, empathetic training, and team collaboration.

* THRIVE's proprietary Crisis Response for Marginalized Communities curriculum
is centered in Whole-Human, empathetic support, cross-identity
affirmation, trauma-informed care, and skillful deescalation. Our full certificate 
of completion requires 50 hours; Crisis Responders are required to complete 40 hours
of training prior to becoming taking shifts on THRIVE Lifeline.
* Volunteers can work from any location: all that is required is a computer
with reliable internet and a private space.
* Representation is at the heart of THRIVE. We encourage applications from people who 
identify as **persons of color, persons living with disabilities, Two Spirit, 
trans-femme and/or femme nonbinary individuals, and/or veterans.**

<br>
We have the following volunteer positions available. *Full job descriptions are available in links beside each position.*

   * **Crisis Responder**: Crisis Responder on THRIVE Lifeline. 
     This volunteer will actively talk to, listen to, and help texters to the 
     hotline. 
     [Full Description](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IzXOQbvbEWZ_jM1NnnalyVNk5LDBsTy0/view)
   * **Volunteer Recruiter**: This volunteer will 
   lead a recruitment plan and connect interested volunteers with positions 
   that match their strengths. Estimated 6-8 hours per week.
    [Full Description](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1t-xFH6dK41DBosL5_mZhTG6CBwDNIB-N/view)
   * **Line Supervisor**: Great for grad students or early career professionals 
   who have crisis intervention experience! 
   This volunteer will support Crisis Responders during their shifts being able 
   to provide backup or deescalation in complex situations.  
   Expected 6 hours per week.
   [Full Description](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1j1mX8RMvr7o0zTXxzm-jkLBtJ0qSRLmo/view)
   * **Training Assistant**: This volunteer will support our Crisis Responders in
   Training (CRiT) by acting as texters to the hotline and conducting practice
   text-based interactions at appointed times (within the Assistant's scheduled
   availability). 
   The volunteer will be given one scripted scenario, along with its desired 
   CRiT learning outcomes. 
   A practice interaction will be approximately 40-60 min. 
   Estimated time 6-8 hours per month, highly clustered in certain weeks where 
   training occurs.
   [Full Description](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xkAzZhHrGs4GUVIykK1xxEy6jwouxr08/view)
